sentence.Network_en: Most gateways had a metal grill called a portcullis.
sentence.Network_cn: 大多数通道上都装有叫作吊闸的铁格栅.
吊闸 - 行之有效的紧急保护.
吊闸-在危急时可靠的保护者.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French porte coleice 'sliding door', from porte 'door' (from Latin porta) + coleice 'sliding' (feminine of couleis, from Latin colare 'to filter')

entry.def: A portcullis is a strong gate above an entrance to a castle and used to be lowered to the ground in order to keep out enemies.

means.word_mean: 1. gate consisting of an iron or wooden grating that hangs in the entry to a castle or fortified town; can be lowered to prevent passage

auth_sentence.content: They went beneath the raised portcullis through massive walls.
auth_sentence.res_content: They went beneath the raised portcullis through massive walls.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They went beneath the raised portcullis through massive walls.

auth_sentence.content: We are not talking pink portcullis territory here.
